body.p: “See some Indian pottery from Cayuga Reservation “,” gradments “,” very pale brick-color three eighths of an inch thick “,” with a rude ornament (apparently made with the end of a stick) of this form and size: [image] the lines representing slight hollows in a row around it.”
PE 14, pg. 170/ 9 July 1858-9 November 1858 / NNPM MA 1302:33 / T vol. # XXVII / PDF # XVII / JXI
